meanings.definition: Cool (something) in advance of its use.
meanings.sent1: I precooled the cake before frosting it.
meanings.sent2: Remember to precooled the drinks before the party.
meanings.sent3: The chef precooled the oven, but then forgot to turn it on!
meanings.sent4: She precooled her temper before confronting the issue.
meanings.sent5: Precooling the car engine before a long drive can prevent overheating.

meanings.sent1: The precooled watermelon was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The precooled ice cream was a hit at the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The precooled room felt like a walk-in refrigerator!
meanings.sent4: His precooled demeanor helped him stay calm under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The precooled metal was a relief to touch on a scorching afternoon.
